sameAnalysis.word_list: laugh, smile, giggle, grin, beam, sneer
means: laugh ： 最常用词，指因喜悦、愉快或轻视而出声的笑或大笑。
smile ： 指面露微笑，侧重于无声。
giggle ： 指发出咯咯的笑声，较多地用于女人或孩子。
beam ： 书面用词，指人因心情舒畅而发出的笑，即喜形于色地笑。

sentence.Network_en: The smile disappeared to be replaced by a doleful frown.
sentence.Network_cn: 笑容消失了，取而代之的是哀伤的蹙眉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: perhaps of Scandinavian origin; related to smirk

encyclopedia.content: smile，英文单词，是微笑、笑的意思。《smile》是迈克尔·杰克逊未能发行的单曲，"Smile"的原始出处是《摩登时代》，是卓别林谱写的经典之作。这首歌是迈克尔对于喜剧电影大师卓别林影片的感慨。另外smile是张学友第一张专辑名和薛凯琪同名专辑等。

entry.def: When you smile, the corners of your mouth curve up and you sometimes show your teeth. People smile when they are pleased or amused, or when they are being friendly.

example.ex: When he saw me, he smiled and waved...
example.tran: 他看见我的时候，微笑着朝我挥挥手。

example.ex: He rubbed the back of his neck and smiled ruefully at me...
example.tran: 他挠了挠脖梗儿，对我苦笑了一下。

entry.def: A smile is the expression that you have on your face when you smile.

example.ex: 'There are some sandwiches if you're hungry,' she said with a smile...
example.tran: 她笑道：“你要是饿的话，这有一些三明治。”

entry.def: If you smile something, you say it with a smile or express it by a smile.

example.tran: 她微笑着问：“我们不是很傻吗?”

example.ex: She smiled her thanks and arranged the guitar under her arm.
example.tran: 她微笑着致了谢，把胳膊下面的吉他调整了一下。

entry.def: If you say that something such as fortune smiles on someone, you mean that they are lucky or successful.

example.ex: When fortune smiled on him, he made the most of it...
example.tran: 当好运来临时，他充分把握住了。

example.ex: God is not smiling on our cause.
example.tran: 我们的事业没有得到上帝的垂怜。

entry.tran: 满面笑容(常指先前因某事发愁)
entry.def: If you say that someone is all smiles, you mean that they look very happy, often when they have previously been worried or upset about something.

means.word_mean: 1. a facial expression characterized by turning up the corners of the mouth; usually shows pleasure or amusement
1. change one's facial expression by spreading the lips, often to signal pleasure

auth_sentence.content: They never do smile, they just play Scruggs.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: They never do smile, they just play Scruggs.

auth_sentence.content: Do you really think a smile will change that?
auth_sentence.res_content: Do you really think a smile will change that?

auth_sentence.content: The men in the Kremlin do not smile easily.
auth_sentence.res_content: The men in the Kremlin do not smile easily.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The men in the Kremlin do not smile easily.

sentences.en: A smile of pleasure passed across his face.
sentences.cn: 他脸上露出高兴的微笑。

sentences.en: He was all smiles at the good news.
sentences.cn: 他听到这个好消息时喜形于色。

sentences.en: He was smiling all over his face.

means.word_mean: 以微笑表示, 笑着说

jushi.english: On her face is her accustomed smile.
jushi.chinese: 她脸上带着习惯性的微笑。

jushi.english: Mother eyed Jim with an eager, expectant smile.
jushi.chinese: 母亲带着殷切期望的微笑注视着吉姆。

jushi.english: There was a blind smile on his face.
jushi.chinese: 他脸上露出隐约的笑容。
